definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
variant of 盈餘|盈余[ying2 yu2]
to win without needing to even lift a finger/victory presented on a platter
profitable to both sides/a win-win situation

sentences.english: All you have to do to win is unscramble the words here to find four names of birds.
sentences.chinese: 只要你能从这些单词中找到四种鸟的名称你就赢了。

sentences.english: The Russians eventually won, invading the city in 1868.
sentences.chinese: 俄国最后赢了，于1898年入侵了布哈拉。

sentences.english: I thought the Cougars were going to win for sure.
sentences.chinese: 我开始可是认为美洲豹肯定赢的。

sentences.english: Ten to one but our team will win.
If you cannot win, make the one ahead of you break the record. ----- Jan McKeithen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你赢不了，就帮你前面那个破记录吧。

sentences.english: He won't win even though he stays abreast of the best runner now.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他现在跑得和最快的一样快他也赢不了。

sentences.english: If we win we will be in first place in the Southeast Division.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们赢了，我们就将成为东南赛区第一名。
如果你的实现了，你就赢了。

sentences.english: I won five tricks in that last game.
sentences.chinese: 我最后一局赢了五墩牌。

sentences.english: Sally: Yes, but actually, I want Kylie to win.
sentences.chinese: 是的，但实际上我希望凯琳赢。

sentences.english: The quine[11] won by Europe, paid by France.
sentences.chinese: 是一场欧洲赢了法国输了的赌博。

sentences.english: The person that ends up a winner,is the one who resolves to win.
sentences.chinese: 最终的赢家就是下定决心要赢的那个人。

sentences.english: The earth would stand still if you won Tyler this time.
sentences.chinese: 这次你要是能赢了泰勒，我看地球都会停止不转了。

sentences.english: Who dares, and I compare? Who will win, who belongs to the Ministry of Supervision site.
sentences.chinese: 谁敢和我比？谁赢，监察部的地盘属于谁。

sentences.english: I beat Dick in billiards because he gave me tremendous odds.
sentences.chinese: 打弹子球我赢了迪克，因为他让了我很多。

sentences.english: The defending champoin won the first set, but the challenger took the second.
sentences.chinese: 擂主赢了第一回合，但是第二回合是挑战者获胜。

definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to take defeat with bad grace/to be a sore loser/cannot afford to lose
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
